newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stks close up on key trades, CANTV optimism.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stks close up on key trades, CANTV optimism.

text.p: Caracas stocks edged ahead led by key trades in selected stocks and growing optimism that the global share offering of telephone company CANTV would boost foreign interest in Venezuelan shares, traders said
The bolsa's index closed up 0.69 percent at 6,007.69 points as 17 stocks rose, nine fell and seven ended flat.
"Demand was up today, we are all watching out for the end of the CANTV placement," said Vencred broker Geronimo Paolini.
A total of 11.5 million shares traded worth 3.8 billion bolivars ($8.1 million).

Steel producer Sivensa closed up 10.00 bolivars at 349.00 on news the company board would recommend an extra cash dividend of 2.50 bolivars per share and a one-for-one share dividend at its January general meeting, traders said.
Among the day's other leading trades, shares at Sudamtex's holding company Venaseta rose 3.50 bolivars to 46.00 and 6.95 to 49.95 respectively.
